Description:
The purpose of this RFP is to solicit proposals from qualified Vendors for Program administration services, as detailed further in Section 5.0, Scope of Work. Using the responses from the RFP, the Department plans to identify a Vendor who will provide such services to the Department when the need arises.
Per Part 2 of North Carolina General Statute 58, Article 44, created a non-adversarial mediation program (“Program”) to facilitate the effective, fair and timely handling of insurance claims disputes that follow property damage caused by disasters. The availability of the Program is triggered by a state of disaster being proclaimed for the State or an area withing the State by the Governor under G.S. 166A-19.21, or by the President of the United States issuing a major disaster declaration for the State or for an areas within the State under the Robert T. Stafford Relief and Emergency Assistance Act, 42 U.S.C. § 5121, et seq., as amended. The North Carolina Department of Insurance, or its designee, is responsible for administering the Program. 
No State funds will be used for the mediation Program. All costs associated with the Program will be paid on a per-case basis by insurance companies whose insureds utilize the Program.  
The intent of this solicitation is to award an Agency Specific Contract.
Attachments: 12-001257-Administer NC Disaster Mediation Program(RFP).pdf

Description:
The North Carolina Home Inspector Licensure Board (NCHILB or Board) is responsible for creating a Board-developed Continuing Education (CE) Update Course annually for licensees on active status. The North Carolina Department of Insurance (NCDOI), Office of State Fire Marshal, Engineering Division provides staff to this Board. The update course provides four (4) hours of the total twelve (12) hour annual CE currently required to renew a license by September 30th. The other eight (8) hours are provided through elective courses developed by Board-approved Education Sponsors. N.C. Gen. Stat. §143-151.49(a)(12) and §143-151.64 provide legislative authority. N.C. Administrative Code 11 NCAC 08 Section .1300 provides specific information on CE requirements including the Update Course. 11 NCAC 08.1309 Update Course Component, subparagraph (b) states in part “The subject matter of this course shall be determined by the Board, which shall prepare a completely new course for each one-year period beginning October 1 and ending September 30. Sponsors shall acquire the Board-developed course materials and utilize such materials to conduct the update course. The course shall be conducted exactly as prescribed by the rules in this Section and the course materials developed by the Board. Sponsors shall provide licensees participating in their classes a copy of the student materials developed by the Board.”
The Board By-Laws provide for several standing committees, one of which is the Education Committee. The Education Committee is responsible for administering the CE program, including determining the mandatory and update courses required each year and for administering the Pre-licensing education program, including determining the scope and extent of required courses. For the license renewal period / CE year October 1, 2025 through September 30, 2026, the Education Committee has recommended, and the Board has approved, an Update Course entitled “The Purpose and Scope of the Direction Statement.”
Since its creation in 1996, the Board has developed some update courses in-house using committee members and staff. Multiple vendors may have an interest in developing such a course. Typically, the concept of the course and learning outcomes to be achieved are discussed with the vendor in one or more committee scoping sessions in the first quarter of the calendar year using prior courses as a reference. The vendor then prepares an outline and/or draft of the course and submits the same to the Education Committee for review and approval prior to the April meeting of the Board. The final submission to the committee is then recommended for approval by the Board no later than the July meeting of the Board. Once the Update Course receives final Board approval, the vendor schedules a workshop for all Board-approved Update Course Sponsors and Instructors interested in teaching the Update Course. The vendor provides all workshop attendees the course Sponsor, Instructor and Student materials and teaches the course so that the course “shall be conducted exactly as prescribed…” Update Course Sponsors and Instructors are responsible for making copies of all materials for their students. 11 NCAC 08.1312 requires the student fee paid for the Update Course to be all-inclusive, and no separate or additional fee may be charged to students for providing course materials required by the Board, providing course completion certificates, reporting course completion to the Board, or for recouping similar routine administrative expenses. The total amount of any fees to be charged shall be included in any advertising or promotional materials for the course.
Additional information is available through the Board web site <span style="mso-ascii-font-family: Calibri;mso-asci
Attachments: 12-001263 NCHILB Board Developed Update Course FY 2025-2026

The Orange Water and Sewer Authority (OWASA) is seeking Proposals from qualified and
experienced commercial janitorial/cleaning service firms to provide evening
janitorial/cleaning service 5 days a week for 2 locations at 400 Jones Ferry Road Carrboro, NC
27510–Water Treament Plant and 170 Old Manson Farm Road Chapel Hill, NC 27514–Waste
Water Treatment Plant. This is an informal request for proposals and the proposals received
will not be public until the contract is awarded.
NC Certified HUB Vendors are encouraged to submit Proposals for all solicitation opportunities at

To obtain a copy of the Request for Proposal (RFP) document, suppliers shall download the
document from the OWASA’S website at https://www.owasa.org/Proposal-opportunities
A mandatory Pre-Proposal Meeting and Site Visit will be held for all prospective
proposers on December 11, 2024, at 10:00 am, located at 400 Jones Ferry Road, Carrboro,
NC 27510. Attendance is required to gain a full understanding of the project scope and site
conditions. This session will allow proposers to ask questions and obtain critical information
needed for preparing thorough and accurate proposals.
Proposals are solicited and will be accepted in PDF format via email at dmoore@owasa.org
until 3:00 p.m. ET on Friday, December 20, 2024, for the JANITORIAL SERVICES
SOLICITATION.
Questions regarding the RFP shall be directed to David Moore, Procurement Coordinator at
dmoore@owasa.org.
OWASA reserves the right to reject any or all Proposals.

Description: This request for proposals is for Construction Manager at Risk Services for the Rowan-Cabarrus Community College’s (RCCC) North Campus Parking Lot A & B Reconfiguration. The project consists of demolition and construction of reconfigured parking areas A & B, related infrastructure, and realignment of Navigation Way in the vicinity of these parking areas.  The Project will include all associated utilities, drainage, retention, hardscape, landscape, site furnishings, security systems, lighting, EV charging, digital signage, directional signage, and a solar canopy. Specific goals for the project are addressed in the Parking Lot A & B Reconfiguration, Owners Project Requirements dated August 26, 2024. The scope of work for this selection will include pre-construction services, construction management at risk, and project close-out.  The Construction Manager at Risk shall seek all required approvals, handle bidding of subcontracts, and administer the construction under a Construction Manager at Risk delivery model. The project will be designed and administered under State Construction Office requirements.  The project will require phasing during construction to allow Navigation Way, the parking lots “A” and “B” to be demolished and constructed separately to provide campus traffic and parking during the project.

Department: DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES
Description: The Department of Natural and Cultural Resources (hereinafter, “Department”) invites Vendors specializing in fine arts moving to submit bids to move the collections and storage equipment of the NC Museum of History (hereinafter referred to as “Museum”) from 5 East Edenton Street, Raleigh, NC to two warehouses within 20 miles of the museum.  The work consists of moving the artifact collection, which consists of 90,000+ items and is located on all floors and the exterior of the building. The existing shelving and storage equipment at the Edenton Street location will need to be disassembled, transported to the warehouse, then reassembled by the Vendor. Many of the artifacts will need specialized handling, and some will need specialized rigging by the Vendor.  These types of artifacts have a range of fragility and are a range between household items, clothing, jewelry, furniture, military armaments, structures, cars, and small appliances. It is anticipated that approximately ¾ of the packing will be accomplished by Museum staff, the Vendor will need to complete the rest. Early estimates indicate about 300 pallet loads + large furniture + rigged items. All packing materials will be furnished by the Museum, but Vendor shall be responsible for furnishing moving equipment and tools, specialized rigging equipment, carts and A-Frames. The intent of this solicitation is to award an Agency Contract. <span style="font-size:10.0pt;font-family: "Calibri",sans-serif;mso-ascii-theme-font:minor-latin;mso-hansi-theme-font: minor-latin;mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-latin;font-style:normal;mso-bidi-font-style:

The North Carolina Department of Public Safety, Division of Emergency Management (NCEM) is soliciting proposals to acquire the services of a qualified Vendor to thoroughly and rapidly validate reimbursement requests for EMAC as well as In-State Mutual Aid Reimbursement within the State of North Carolina, due to its extensive response for Hurricane Helene. The validation should utilize the standard EMAC Workbook being complete and thorough to ensure all reimbursed costs are aligned with the current Public Assistance Program and Policy Guide (PAPPG) and the State’s reimbursement guidelines. The validation will confirm the substantiation of all requested reimbursements. The validation will include the formulation of a specialized and organized approach, correspondence with the local agencies, and tracking the mutual aid responses across the event. All validation packages will be provided in a shared drive with clear outlines of substantiated costs and supporting documents. The intent of this solicitation is to award an Agency Specific Contract.
Attachments: 19-RFP-1341105318-PTW - DPS - NC Emergency Management EMAC Validation - RQ158390.pdf

Description:
This request for proposals is for civil engineering design and construction management services for the Rowan-Cabarrus Community College’s (RCCC) North Campus Fire Training Center Infrastructure Extensions. 
The project is envisioned as extension of water, sewer and other utilities as well as roadways and drives to the Fire Training Center on North Campus. The project will include all associated utilities, drainage, and retention.
Specific goals for the project and individual buildings are addressed in this draft document. The scope of work includes: schematic design, design development, construction documents, construction administration, project close-out, warranty period management (1 year), and performance verification.  
The project will include site development, yielding fully functional facilities. The Engineer shall seek all required approvals, handle bidding, and administer the construction under a CM at Risk delivery model. The project will be designed and administered as a formal project under State Construction Office requirements.

The Winston-Salem Fire Department (WSFD) is seeking proposals from qualified consulting firms or agencies to design and validate a new, comprehensive job-related physical ability test in Winston-Salem, North Carolina. This process will focus on developing two key events: the aerial ladder climb and a comprehensive physical fitness test. The newly designed tests must be compliant with industry standards, job-related criteria, and legal defensibility for both new hires and current employees. The validated tests will support hiring, training, and career progression within the department while ensuring that current employees maintain the physical standards required for continued employment through annual assessments.
Attachments: WebAd - Physical Ability Test Design and Validation.pdf

Description:
Winston-Salem/Forsyth County Utilities (WSFCU) is seeking proposals from qualified private solid waste consultants to provide various operational consultant services for the Hanes Mill Road Municipal Solid Waste Landfill (HMRL).  

The HMRL Facility is a permitted Subtitle D lined landfill (open and closed units), which also contains scrap tire and white goods collection facilities, and citizen recycling and waste drop-off convenience areas. This facility is operated by WSFCU personnel.

Description: The purpose of this RFP is to solicit offers from qualified Vendors for the procurement of death match audit services for RSD. The Vendor proposed death match audit services will consist of a monthly data file of potential payees to be submitted by RSD to the awarded Vendor via a secure form of data transfer to be matched against sources including but not limited to the Social Security Death Master File (DMF) and State Vital Records (or similar office). Vendor’s proposed death match audit services shall provide matches of deceased persons within RSD provided payee data that will be reported back to RSD showing any payees who are, or may be identified as, deceased, but whose deaths have otherwise not been reported to RSD.
Attachments: RFP 07-2024-IT001 RSD Death Match Audit Services.pdf

Description:
East Carolina University and its Information Technology & Computing Services (ITCS) Department is seeking bids from qualified vendors to accommodate the upgrade, refreshing and support of the University’s Audio Visual and Classroom Technology equipment, interconnects and related installation services on a consistent basis. 
The purpose of this IFB is to supply East Carolina University with both system equipment pricing as well as labor rates for the purpose of purchasing turnkey Audio-Visual System and Classroom Technology Installations. These AV Systems and Classroom Technology upgrades occur year-round and in several different building located on both Main Campus, Athletics Campus, West/Medical Campus, as well as Coastal Studies Campus and may vary. Once this IFB is awarded, an ECU AV Design & Engineering (ECU AVDE) Technology Point of Contact will coordinate with the awarded vendor(s) to define the building(s) and room(s) to be quoted referencing this bid for pricing and labor for the equipment and services needed at that time of the corresponding installation.
 It is the intent of East Carolina University and the ITCS Department to award this IFB to multiple vendors in order to obtain a competitive pricing matrix, support the need required, scheduling flexibility, and the installations/projects at that time. 
It is highly recommended that each bidder read and understand the requirements of this bid solicitation and provide all required information. Incomplete bid responses will be considered nonresponsive and therefore will not be considered. The intent of this solicitation is to award to multiple vendor(s) and a multi-year Agency Contract.
Attachments: 56-2509BWIFB - EAST CAROLINA UNIVERSITY AV Classroom Technology Bid .pdf; 56-2509BWIFB - BID ADDENDA 1 - Questions & Responses.pdf

Description:
The purpose of this Request for Proposal is for placement of a software managed access control system that will monitor and
allow for management of all exterior doors at each of Wilson Community College’s four (4) campus locations. This system will
provide a secure mechanism to close and lock campus doors in the event of a campus emergency. Currently, our on-campus safety
personnel are responsible for manually locking each exterior door on campus.

Description: The Department of Administration (NCDOA), Facility Management Division (Contracting Agency) is responsible for providing efficient, healthy, and safe janitorial service for State buildings. The Contracting Agency (Facility Management Division) shall perform the administration of the contract. Department: DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES - DHHS
Description: Citizen Review Panels (CRPs) were developed in response to a requirement set forth in the 1996 reauthorization for the Child Abuse and Prevention Treatment Act (CAPTA), section 106 (c). The CRPs are directed to evaluate state child welfare agencies and make recommendations for improvement in child protective services. In doing so, they are to assess how well the state is coordinating adoption and foster care programs and how child fatalities are reviewed. The North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (NC DHHS), Division of Social Services (NC DSS) is the state’s child welfare authority responsible for the oversight of CRPs in North Carolina. Currently, to meet federal requirements, NC DSS has designated the state’s existing 101 Community Child Protection Teams (CCPTs) as CRPs. CCPTs are interdisciplinary groups of community representatives that were established in 1991 under N.C. General Statute § 7B-1406, and further formalized and expanded in 1993, to promote a community-wide approach to the problem of child abuse and neglect.  Legislation passed in 2024 requires North Carolina to establish a minimum of 3 CRPs by January 2025 in compliance with the Child Abuse Prevention and Treatment Act (CAPTA).
Attachments: 30-25003-DSS-RD2 Citizen Review Panels RFP.pdf; 30-25003-DSS-RD2 Addendum 1 RFP Schedule 112224.pdf; 30-25003-DSS-RD2 Addendum 2 Questions 1224.pdf

Description: This project consists of designing and constructing a single-level, 30,000 GSF training center at the North Campus at 587 Site. The facility will provide general laboratories and simulated cleanroom environments that facilitate knowledge-based and hands-on skills training on biomanufacturing processes and equipment, including procedures required to meet the expectations of agencies that regulate medical products. Training spaces will feature the same process and testing equipment used by most companies that manufacture biopharmaceutical and industrial bioproducts. If local companies use specialized equipment, similar equipment will be installed in the training center. Flexibility in facility design is critical so that the laboratories and simulated cleanroom environments can be scheduled for academic courses, continuing education, and customized industry training; as well as be adaptable for emerging and/or shifting industry training needs.
Attachments: WCC RFQ for Design.Build Workforce Training Center

Description:
The University of North Carolina (UNC) System encourages the establishment of private organizations, known as Associated Entities, to support the constituent institutions and other units of the University.  Associated Entities engage in activities that are critical to and aligned with the mission, goals, and objectives of the constituent institutions and institutional units with which they are associated. Activities undertaken by Associated Entities include fundraising, provision of services to students and campus organizations, research support, and collaborating with organizations outside the University System to promote and support initiatives and activities that are related to the University’s mission of teaching, research, and service. Associated Entities and the constituent institutions and units of the University with which they are associated rely on the dedicated guidance, support, and leadership of Associated Entity directors, officers, donors, and volunteers to pursue shared goals and objectives.

Per the Regulation on Required Elements of a University-Associated Entity Relationship, the governing body of an Associated Entity, working in collaboration with the Approving Institution’s insurance and risk management personnel, UNC System risk management personnel, or approved vendors, should evaluate the potential risks arising from the operation of the Associated Entity and obtain commercially reasonable amounts of general liability and directors’/officers’ insurance.
Attachments: 68-SOIS1024.pdf; 68-SOIS1024 - Addendum 01.pdf

Department: DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES
Description: A qualified Vendor is needed to assist the North Carolina Division of Archives and History with the development of a project that will study a campaign of the Revolutionary War typically called the “Race to the Dan.” The Race to the Dan River in Virginia was part of the efforts by American Major General Nathaniel Greene to wear down and stretch supply lines for the British under the command of General Lord Cornwallis. Cornwallis had entered North Carolina near Charlotte after an embarrassing defeat at Cowpens in South Carolina. The dramatic six-week pursuit of American troops stretched across the western Piedmont of North Carolina and into Virginia before culminating at the battle of Guilford Courthouse. The project will survey the known sites associated with the Race to the Dan, including campsites, skirmish areas, important river crossings, and other strategic areas associated with General Greene’s efforts to string out, delay, and out maneuver British troops under Cornwallis. The selected Vendor shall be responsible for the compilation of a comprehensive report that incorporates the research and presents a clear study of the battlefields, campsites, and skirmish locations of the military campaign from 1781. The Vendor shall carry out work in a manner that meets the Secretary of Interior's Standards for Archeology and Historic Preservation, any applicable state and local statutes and guidelines, and by a professional that meets or exceeds the Secretary of the Interior’s Professional Qualifications Standards.
Attachments: 46-DNCR-25-2035 RFP Survey and Cultural Resource Management Plan for America 250.pdf; 46-DNCR-25-2035 RFP Addendum No. 1.pdf

Description:
The North Carolina Department of Insurance (DOI) is seeking bids from qualified Vendors to provide professional court reporting and transcription services of administrative hearings, rate hearings, depositions and other civil litigation depositions services for the State of North Carolina.  There are two categories of court reporting and transcription services.  Category #1 consists of court reporting and transcription services that arise from DOI administrative hearings and depositions excluding insurance rate hearings and depositions.  It also includes court reporting and transcription services for depositions arising from DOI administrative proceedings and other civil litigation.  Category #2 consists of court reporting and transcription services of administrative hearings involving insurance rate matters and related depositions.  Using the responses from this IFB, the DOI plans to identify one or more qualified vendors to provide court reporting and transcription services to DOI when the need arises.  By placing one or more qualified vendors on contract to provide professional court reporting and transcription services, the NCDOI will have a list of available vendors who may be used for court reporting and transcription projects as the need arises, and NCDOI will be better prepared to meet its court reporting and transcription needs in a prompt, accurate and professional manner.

The intent of this solicitation is to award an Agency Specific Term Contract.

Description:
The purpose of this IFB is to secure the services of a trained facilitator for a strategic planning session for the North Carolina Home Inspector Licensure Board (“Board”), a state agency licensing board of the Department of Insurance, Office of State Fire Marshal as defined by N.C. Gen. Stat. § 93B-1. The purpose of the Board is to protect the public from being harmed by unqualified persons by regulating the use of the title “Licensed Home Inspector” and by providing for the licensure and regulation of those who perform home inspections for compensation pursuant to N.C. Gen. Stat. § 143-151.44. The Board does not have a strategic plan. 
Strategic planning is an effective tool used by government and business to improve organizational performance. Strategic plans help managers develop a detailed course of action. The Board currently has a significant fund balance due to the strong housing market of the past several years. Tens of thousands of home inspections are performed on existing homes each year. The number of home inspections performed on new construction homes is significant. 
A two (2) day session is anticipated in association with a regular quarterly meeting of the Board October 9 and 10, 2024, with public notice and opportunity for public comment. 
The Board consists of eight (8) members appointed pursuant to N.C. Gen. Stat. § 143-151.46. The Engineering Division provides clerical and other staff services required by the Board pursuant to N.C. Gen. Stat. § 143-151.63. Staff is functionally organized to administer licenses, examinations, education programs and complaint investigation services.

Description:
East Carolina University and its Information Technology and Computing Services Department (ITCS) is seeking bids from qualified vendors to install, repair and remove communications cabling and equipment located on/in any East Carolina University building/facility on either East or West Campus, within the City of Greenville and Pitt County as well as other East Carolina University locations within the State. 
East Carolina University Information Technology and Computing Services (ITCS) is responsible for installations, upgrades, and interconnection of the communications infrastructure in more than 200 buildings on the East Carolina University campuses located withing the City of Greenville and Pitt County. This work involves installation, removal, troubleshooting, interconnecting of cabling, passive and active voice/data/CA TV equipment and other equipment that is part of the Information Technology (IT) Infrastructure. The awarded Vendor(s) will provide the labor required to perform these duties and requested services. East Carolina University reserves the right to award this to one or more Vendors to perform the requested duties, services and related work. 
It is highly recommended that each bidder read and understand the requirements of this bid solicitation and provide all required information. Incomplete bid responses will be considered nonresponsive and therefore will not be considered. The intent of this solicitation is to award a multi-year Agency Contract.

Description:
The University’s overall goal in soliciting a Supplier to provide Dining management services is to ensure the highest level of effectiveness, service, and satisfaction is being provided to the campus.  The UNCP dining provider will need to allow customers the ability to choose from multiple locations and service styles. Also, to include the enhancement of the dining experience, to support the student’s well-being, academic success, and overall satisfaction with campus life. It is essential that the Dining establishments be managed with maximum responsiveness to the needs and concerns of our students, faculty, and staff. Products, prices, and services must promote confidence that the university community is obtaining the best possible combination of quality, customer service, and value. A critical aspect in meeting the foregoing goals is the identification, selection, and retention of a highly knowledgeable and first rate on site management team.
The successful Supplier will provide a state-of-the-art dining management process and system that will allow the university dining management team to provide excellent service to its constituents.  The new dining management service will be capable of expansion as the dining program continues to grow. As such, the successful Supplier will have an eye on the future and will continue to provide innovative technologies and service solutions for dining customers over time.
UNCP seeks a company that will act as a true strategic and operational partner in ensuring that the Dining Services Program fully aligns with the University’s needs and standards of excellence. The following are the University of North Carolina at Pembroke's key aspirations and priorities for the Program.
1.	Recommend optimal national/regional branded concepts for the new Allied Health Sciences Building to serve students, faculty, staff, and the public utilizing health care services. Allocate funds for the build-out of the new space, scheduled to open in Fall 2028.
2.	Maintain the existing Chick-Fil-A and Starbucks.
3.	Propose the recommended approach to balancing national/regional branded concepts and in-house branded concepts on campus, considering the addition of Panera Bread or Chipotle. 
4.	Allocate funds necessary for branded concept refreshes.
5.	Revitalize and redefine Cafe 641 located in the Library Building.
6.	Incorporate additional late-night options for students who are involved in extracurriculars or are involved in a non-traditional academic schedule. 
7.	Conduct a comprehensive review of meal plans to ensure clear distinctions between plan types.
8.	Optimize the capital refresh of all dining facilities.
9.	Develop a comprehensive marketing plan, and innovative delivery methods aimed at increasing engagement and usage of dining services within the campus community.
10.	Provide at least one tier of genuinely low-cost catering options available to any UNCP affiliated group/department.
11.	Implement application/platform ordering options for all dining locations.

Description: Request for Proposals (RFP) are issued to prospective vendors for brand strategy and management services for East Carolina University (hereinafter referred to as ECU or University). Description:
This request for proposals is for civil engineering design and construction management services for the Rowan-Cabarrus Community College’s (RCCC) North Campus Parking Lot A & B Reconfiguration. 

The project consists of demolition and construction of reconfigured parking areas A & B, related infrastructure, and realignment of Navigation Way in the vicinity of these parking areas.  The Project will include all associated utilities, drainage, retention, hardscape, landscape, site furnishings, security systems, lighting, EV charging, digital signage, directional signage, and a solar canopy.

Specific goals for the project and individual buildings are addressed in this draft document. The scope of work includes: schematic design, design development, construction documents, construction administration, project close-out, warranty period management (1 year), and performance verification.  

The project will include site development, yielding fully functional facilities. The Designer shall seek all required approvals, handle bidding, and administer the construction under a CM at Risk delivery model. The project will be designed and administered as a formal project under State Construction Office requirements.

The project will require phasing during construction to allow Navigation Way, the parking lots “A” and “B” to be demolished and constructed separately to provide campus traffic and parking during the project.

Full Delivery Projects to Provide Stream, Riparian Wetland and NonRiparian Wetland Mitigation Credits within the Cataloguing Unit 03030004 of the Cape Fear River Basin as described in the Scope of Work

Description: The State of North Carolina, Department of Public Safety, Division of Juvenile Justice & Delinquency Prevention (DJJDP), intends tosecureacontractfortheprovisionof Health Care Services (HCS)and staff(NP/PA, RN, LPN, Med Techs/CNA II)whowillserve as clinical healthcare providers for juveniles in the custody and care of the Department. The Contractor will provide medical services to the Youth Development Center and the Juvenile Detention Center. Historically, HCS staff work 40 hours per week. Work schedules may range from 8-hour shifts Monday through Friday and/or three 12- hour shifts with alternating weekends. NC Juvenile code requires developmentally appropriate healthcare to be provided to juveniles while held in custody by or committed to DJJDP. Juvenile Health Services is dedicated to meeting the health and health education needs of the youths in Juvenile Justice facilities. Professional healthcare staff screen and assess youth upon admission, develop healthcare plans and provide appropriate interventions and/or follow-up that may include referral for specialty assessment and intervention.

Description:
The Little Creek Greenway Phase 2 project proposed to extend a greenway 3,500 ft from the current terminus of Little Creek Greenway Phase 1 near Atwood Acres to Somerset Drive.  The greenway will be a ten-foot asphalt path with ditches and drainage.  Improvements are also proposed along Somerset Drive to connect to the greenway to adjacent neighborhoods. 
The Salem Creek Greenway Pedestrian Sidepath project proposed to construct an alternative route for the Salem Creek Greenway from Washington Park to Peters Creek Parkway, following Hutton Street, Link Road, and Lockland Avenue.  This project will add improvements for both pedestrians and bicycle user including the installation of sidewalk, curb ramps and refuge islands as well as resurfacing the route for bike lanes.  Improvements also include modifications to two traffic signals to accommodate pedestrian movements.
Attachments: Ad-Little Creek and Salem Creek Greenway FB2537.pdf

Description:
The UNC Chief of Police, is charged with ensuring proper law enforcement staffing on campus for special events to include athletic events.  The events that require the most staffing are Men’s Basketball and Football.  Currently we utilize assistance from the law enforcement agencies with UNC Hospitals, Orange County, the Town of Chapel Hill and Carrboro.  The university reimburses those entities at the time and a half rate of those officers plus fringe benefits.  UNC PD would like to contract with a company that can procure officers whose agencies through agreement with UNC have allowed those officers to work special events.      All officers, absent UNC PD Officers, would be compensated at a standard rate.  The service requirements we are looking for are as follows:

•	Vendor has web-based mechanism which allows UNC PD to post assignments and allows eligible officers to sign up electronically
•	Vendor has ability to directly pay individual officers 
•	Vendor has ability to calculate total cost for each event, including pre-determined administrative fees and bill UNC
•	Vendor has 24/7 customer service capabilities
•	Vendor provides supplemental insurance that covers general and professional liability
•	Vendor maintains scheduling and event history that can be accessed electronically

This change in procurement will enable UNC to have more adequate staffing for university events and will also allow departments to better predict and budget for costs associated with these events.
Vendor: Hart Halsey dba Extra Duty Solutions
Attachments: 3000011888 EMB Supplemental Event Policing RFP.pdf

Description: The purpose for North Carolina’s Safety Organized Practice is to support families and children who are involved with the child welfare system Assessments and In Home Services through an investment promoting a knowledgeable and trained workforce with consistent support and expertise from NC DSS staff. SOP is a collaborative approach to child welfare casework that helps all parties involved with the child stay focused on assessing and enhancing daily child safety. This approach includes three overarching objectives:• Developing Good Working Relationships• Critical thinking and Using Decision-Support Assessment Tools• Collaborative PlanningThese three objectives include balanced interviewing techniques and tools, tools to include a child’s voice in case planning that are developmentally appropriate, and using a common language to bring clarity to how families and professionals describe the same situations. These objectives also include a group process to organize and analyze case information to create clear and understandable next steps, use of SDM tools support decision making and the creation of worry statements in non-judgmental language to provide rationale for continued child welfare involvement. Clear goals in case plans describe what needs to happen for case closure, support networks are developed to help keep the child safe and plans are behaviorally specific.
Attachments: 30-24406-DSS--State Staff Coaching and Training--RFP.pdf (1.50 MB); 30-24406-DSS--State Staff Coaching and Training--Addendum 1.pdf

The IFB will establish an agency specific contract as permitted by 9 NCAC 6B.0701 to allow for an initial purchase of up to 400 modems, and 800 of the required accessories, and extended warranty services during a 12-month period at the sole discretion of the State.  The agency will also purchase additional products and services as needed throughout the Agreement.  The term of the awarded IFB will be for a three-year period.  
NOTE: Some items are Brand Specific.  These are listed separately with manufacturer and part numbers identified in Section 4.0 FURNISH AND DELIVER.  Some items are NOT Brand Specific but are specified as “Functionally Equivalent” to a particular manufacturer part number.
Attachments: IFB-54-12114231-CS Wireless Modems 3-yr_for posting.pdf; Addendum 1 for IFB 54-12114231-CS Q&A_v2.doc

Description: multiclamp

NC State Office of Information Technology (hereafter referred to as the University) seeks proposals from qualified contractors to provide services to design and build up to two (2) completed trucks (ready to drive and use) with modifications as described below. The truck(s) will be used as a mobile esports arena that will travel around North Carolina to provide an alternative arena experience in a wide variety of locations. They should provide a similar experience to the NC State esports and game lab in Hunt Library (https://www.lib.ncsu.edu/spaces/gaming-esports-lab ). Events can expect up to 250 spectators.

The trucks will need to be capable of multiple configurations, including the ability to take the equipment off the trucks and into buildings with connections to the network, production services and power in the trucks. The mobile esports arena must be able to transform into an arena with a large stage and an adjacent space that houses all the high end gaming-type equipment plus the network support.
Attachments: KGS997423 Submission Instructions.pdf; KGS997423_Design-Build Esports Mobile Truck.pdf (1.31 MB); KGS997423_Addendum #1.pdf; KGS997423_Addendum #2.pdf; KGS997423_Addendum #3.pdf

Description:
Gaston College seeks a vendor to customize, manufacture, deliver, and install a de-escalation center to be used for live-fire training by law enforcement and law enforcement trainees to practice and review scenario-based tactics in de-escalation to avoid the use of force in confrontational and/or deadly situations. The College envisions a facility with three major components: 1) Physical facility; 2) After-Action Review Camera System; 3) Hit Detection Target System.

Gaston College seeks to enhance its ability to train students in law enforcement and criminal justice training programs through the one-time purchase of a De-Escalation System to be located in Gastonia, NC. The goal of de-escalation is to reduce the likelihood of needing force or the amount of force required to resolve a potentially volatile situation.
Gaston College seeks a vendor, with a proven track record in manufacturing and assembling a high-quality live-fire training facility, to customize, manufacture, deliver, and install a de-escalation center, similar to a shoot house, to be used for live-fire training by law enforcement and law enforcement trainees to practice and review scenario-based tactics in de-escalation to avoid use of force in confrontational and/or deadly situations.
Attachments: 98-16671-GC - De-Escalation Training System -5-2-2024 FINAL.pdf

Description: The North Carolina Department of Environmental Quality seeks a vendor (or vendors) to conduct a Statewide Materials Management Optimization Study to understand the composition of the state’s waste stream and provide a comprehensive analysis of recycling processing throughout the state. The study will identify opportunities for source reduction and diversion to recycling, composting, and other preferred management pathways. Additionally, the study will identify gaps in diversion capacity and opportunities for improvements to recycling infrastructure, operations, and transportation.
Attachments: 16-100163-KP-DEQ-Materials Management Optimization 050224.pdf; 16-100163-KP -Addendum No. 1 for Materials Management Optimization.pdf

Department: NORTH CAROLINA AGRICULTURE AND TECHNICAL STATE UNIVERSITY
Description: This is a turnkey project. The University is seeking a qualified commercial painting contractor to furnish all labor, equipment, supplies, services, and supervision required to prime, paint and repair walls in the interiors of McNair Engineering building for approximately 58,094 of assignable space (+/- or up to 85,000) sq. ft. Contractor will use the existing standard color for painting which is most likely Navaho White. Contractors are encouraged to take their own measurements and must verify the field. Contractors are expected to use the appropriate methods for priming, painting, and the repairing of walls in accordance with the specifications herein. Painting shall consist of classrooms, offices, corridors, communal areas, other general service areas and trims. Trim colors may differ. There shall be no accent colors used. Painting shall not include exteriors or closet spaces. Contractor may not use University sinks or bathrooms for paint clean up. Contractors may not dispose of painting materials in any University waste disposal units or any place on the University’s campus. Painting materials must be disposed of offsite in an environmentally approved manner
Attachments: 59-Q6729 Painting Services of McNair Hall.pdf

Description:
The North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics (NCSSM) located in Durham, NC, is seeking competitive bids from qualified vendors to furnish and deliver one (1) water-cooled chiller as part of the chiller plant expansion project. NCSSM is Owner-Furnishing this chiller in advance of execution of the project construction contract to ensure the chiller is on-hand in time for the project completion in Summer 2025. (Students will reoccupy the residence halls for the start of classes in early August 2025.) The unit will be Contractor-Installed as part of the future renovation construction (single prime). 
Drawings and specifications for the chiller are attached to this Invitation for Bids (IFB). Delivery date is a critical consideration, and vendors may submit multiple options in their bid. Clearly distinguish the unit selection, cost, and delivery date for each option submitted. Delivery date shall be on or before late January 2025. Minor variations (inches) in the specified unit size dimensions may be considered in order to improve the delivery date.

Description:
The Purchasing department is assisting the University’s Office of Strategic Communication in seeking a videography company to provide comprehensive videography and audio production services. This includes, but is not limited to the following:
• Pre-production planning, including script development, and logistics.
• Filming and recording of video and audio content using professional-grade equipment. This may include conducting interviews and recording voiceovers.
• Editing and post-production services, including color correction, audio enhancement, and graphics incorporation.
• Provide raw footage and audio recordings, draft versions for review and feedback, and a final, edited video and/or audio content.
• Delivery of final, polished content in various formats suitable for online and offline distribution. The final product should meet FSU brand standards.
• All deliverables must meet high-quality standards, including crisp visuals, clear audio, and professional editing. The vendor is expected to incorporate feedback and revisions as needed. The scope of work will be defined in detail for each individual project.

Department: STATE OF NC - SCHOOL OF SCIENCE AND MATH
Description:
The North Carolina School of Science and Mathematics (NCSSM) is requesting proposals from vendors for one (1) hot water equipment system skid including the shell and tube heat exchanger, condensate receiver pump, inline hot water pumps, F&T steam trap on HX discharge, and related piping, valves, and strainers. as part of the Hill Residence Hall Renovation project. NCSSM is Owner-Furnishing this hot water skid system in advance of execution of the project construction contract to ensure the hot water skid system is on-hand in time for the project completion in November 2024. (Students will reoccupy the residence hall for start of classes in early January 2025.) The unit will be Contractor-Installed as part of the renovation construction (single prime). 
Drawings and specifications for the hot water skid system are attached to this RFP. Lead-time is a critical consideration, and vendors may submit multiple options in their bid. Clearly distinguish the unit selection, cost, and lead-time for each option submitted. For use in determining options, the ideal unit delivery date would be on or before mid-October 2024. Minor variations (inches) in the specified unit size dimensions may be considered in order to improve lead-time.
Vendor: JMP EQUIPMENT COMPANY, LLC, A DIVISION OF JAMES M. PLEASANT COMPANY

Description: Building S202 is an existing 3-story classroom building of approximately 40,000 total square feet, originally constructed in 1999. Since then, various renovations have taken place within the building.  Work performed under this agreement is to be developed in accordance with the RCCC Facilities Design Manual and North Carolina State Construction Office requirements.  Work will take place within an occupied building on an occupied campus. Work to the second and third floors must be completed over the College’s summer schedule, between May 14, 2024 and the beginning of Fall Term on August 9, 2024, including Owner installed classroom technology, furniture and equipment. The remainder of the work will be completed on a schedule mutually agreed upon between the Owner and Contractor.  Additional detailed information is included in the prequalification document.

Description: The Work shall consist of replacing the main 1,200 ampere electrical service switchboard and some of the existing panelboards located in the Main Electrical Room.  Feeders for the replaced panelboards shall be replaced.  Additional associated work required to clean up the Main Electrical Room, along with removing an existing water heater and installing, and connecting a new water heater (furnished by the Owner) will be required.  Due the possible long delivery time for the switchboard, the work will need to be phased, with as much work that can be done prior to the installation of the new switchboard as possible.  The installation of the switchboard will require the Duke Energy transformer to be de-energized, and the shutdown of the building.  This work will need to be scheduled in advance with the Owner and may have to be done on holidays and weekends.

Description: New playground equipment and installation. This project includes necessary ground preparations, design playground space to meet all requirements and adequate student numbers.  All equipment must meet the ASTM and CPSC safety standards. Playground equipment should accommodate children ages 5-12, be able to support 50-60 children, should offer an assortment of slides and climbing options (preferably without many crawling tubes, must also include 2 pieces of inclusive equipment. This project includes design playground space to incorporate the inclusive equipment in the playground layout so that all children feel like they are playing together.  The equipment should meet all safety requirements to meet Federal standards and accommodate adequate student numbers. We plan a two part bid: one part is for the equipment and the other is for the installation of the equipment.  We expect each bidder to participate in each part of the bid.  Failure to bid installation for your equipment could void your bid.
Attachments: RES Playground Bid.pdf (1.40 MB); Bid Addendum #1 - Questions and Answers.pdf

Description: The North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (“NCDHHS” or “Department”), Division of Health Benefits (“DHB”), seeks to procure an experienced and qualified partner to meet the unique health care needs of children, youth and families served by the child welfare system. The Children and Families Specialty Plan (“CFSP”) will operate statewide, enabling Members to access a broad range of physical health and Behavioral Health services and maintain treatment plans when their geographic locations change. As the single entity accountable for the health care of these Members, CFSP will seek to mitigate disruptions in care and facilitate the goal of achieving the right care at the right time for all CFSP Members, in close coordination with County Departments of Social Services (County DSS) and other stakeholders involved in serving this population. The CFSP will be an integrated Medicaid Managed Care plan and is required to cover the services specified in this Request for Proposals (RFP) to address the spectrum of its Members’ needs, including those related to physical health, Behavioral Health, I/DD, LTSS, and pharmacy services and Unmet Health-Related Resource Needs. This RFP is comprised of four (4) parts: 01 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001  Sections I-IV (to Issue 02072024), 02 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Section V (to Issue 02072024), 03 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Sections VI-VIII (to Issue 02072024) and 04 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Section IX Offeror’s RFP Proposal and Response (to Issue 02072024).
Vendor: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina
Attachments: 01 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Sections I-IV; 02 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Section V (to Issue 02072024)_.pdf (3.04 MB); 03 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Section VI-VIII (to Issue 02072024)_.pdf (1.59 MB); 04 CFSP RFP 30-2024-001 Section IX Offeror's RFP Proposal and Response (to Issue 02072024)_.pdf (1.11 MB); Addendum 1 30-2024-001 CFSP RFP.pdf (1.99 MB); Addendum 2 30-2024-001 CFSP RFP.pdf; Addendum 3 30-2024-001 CFSP RFP.pdf (1.56 MB); Addendum 4 30-2024-001 CFSP RFP Response to Questions.pdf (1.19 MB); Addendum 5 30-2024-001 CFSP Revisions to the RFP.pdf (1.22 MB); Addendum 6 30-2024-001 CFSP Revisions to the RFP.pdf

Description: The North Carolina Department of Health and Human Services (“NCDHHS” or “Department”), Division of Health Benefits (“DHB”), through Money Follow the Person Demonstration Project (“MFP”), seeks to procure an experienced and qualified partner to serve as MFP Transition Coordinator for the services defined herein. Description:
North Carolina State Ports Authority is accepting construction bids for pavement upgrades to the inland port located at  1301 Exchange Street, Charlotte, NC. Bids will be received for Single prime construction contract. All proposals shall be lump sum.
The project includes:
furnishing materials identified in the contract documents and the provision of all labor and equipment to perform the work associated with the project. The project includes the removal and stockpiling of approximately 2.2 acres of aggregate base course in the existing gravel yard, grading and subgrade preparation, replacement and addition of aggregate base course and placement of heavy-duty asphalt pavement. 
Replacement of approximately 2 acres of existing asphalt container yard with a thicker asphalt and aggregate base course section. 
Milling and overlay of approximately 0.4 acres at the entrance and exit of the terminal, and 
Provide erosion control, storm drainage installation and paint striping of the container yard.
Attachments: Advertisement for Bids - Charlotte Inland Port Paving Upgrades.pdf
